Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial on Time to Hemostasis in Bleeding Trauma Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial utilized data from the PROPPR trial

Participants.evidence: Eligible participants were those undergoing emergent procedures within 90 minutes

Intervention.evidence: Hemostasis was defined as no intraoperative bleeding requiring intervention or resolution of contrast blush

Objective.evidence: This study investigates the association between time to hemostasis and patient outcomes

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 680 enrolled patients, 468 underwent emergent procedures

Result_Outcome.evidence: every 15-minute reduction in time to hemostasis was linked to decreased 30-day mortality (RR 0.97, 95% CI 0.94–0.99)

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided
